chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: A vase that has trouble standing up won't be a vase for long.
origin_of_ch_char_book: The coronation ceremony of Prince. The officials at the royal court were seated according to their status. The ceremonial practices were conducted in accordance with 13 procedures. Early 19th century in Korea. < National Palace Museum of Korea > Vassals in East Asia had to wear clothes in different colors depending on their status. Even when the memorial service was held at the royal palace, they had to be placed in a designated location. (ä½, wei, position; location) There is a man on the left side bending his waist (äºº, ren, human, people), and a well-dressed nobleman standing on the right side (ç«‹, li, stand). When the ceremonies were held in the royal court, the officials stood in position according to their status.
humanum_full_description_en:
" Li " is " ğ¡—“ ", from the big to " one ". " One " is the ground. Like a person standing on the ground with outstretched arms. The original meaning is standing. "Shuowen": "Stand up, live. From the big one above the one. All those who stand up follow the standing."

The oracle bone inscription means erection, and "lizhong" means erecting a flag, which is used to gather crowds or measure wind direction. They read as " hand-drive ", "Lishi" ie temporary thing. Also used as a person's name and sacrifice name. Jin Wen said to stand, the wise husband Shanding: "Get started, stand up for the middle court." It is also pronounced as " position ", which means the place and position of standing, etc. Mi Bogui: "to stand (position)", Zhongshan Wang Fanghu "subjects stand (position)" Bronze and read as " hand-drive ", "Lishi" That is something temporary, presided over the affairs.

The bamboo slips of the Warring States Period are pronounced " bit ", "Shanghai Bo Yi. "Confucius Poetry Theory": "We must respect and not (its) stand (position)".

" Li" is " ğ¡—“", from the big to " one". " One" is the ground. Like a person standing on the ground with outstretched arms. The original meaning is standing. "Shuowen": "Stand up, live. From the big one above the one. All those who stand up follow the standing." The oracle bone inscription means erection, and "lizhong" means erecting a flag, which is used to gather crowds or measure wind direction. They read as " hand-drive", "Lishi" ie temporary thing. Also used as a person's name and sacrifice name. Jin Wen said to stand, the wise husband Shanding: "Get started, stand up for the middle court." It is also pronounced as " position", which means the place and position of standing, etc. Mi Bogui: "to stand (position)", Zhongshan Wang Fanghu "subjects stand (position)" Bronze and read as " hand-drive", "Lishi" That is something temporary, presided over the affairs. The bamboo slips of the Warring States Period are pronounced " bit", "Shanghai Bo Yi. "Confucius Poetry Theory": "We must respect and not (its) stand (position)".
